meanings.definition: The quality or state of being convertible.
meanings.sent1: Her essay on the convertibilities of currencies was well-received in class.
meanings.sent2: The convertibilities of the old building into a modern office space were impressive.
meanings.sent3: The convertibilities of her wardrobe from casual to formal always amazed her friends.
meanings.sent4: The convertibilities of nature from season to season are a wonder to behold.
meanings.sent5: The teacher explained the convertibilities of fractions using colorful blocks.

meanings.sent1: The machine's convertibilities made it versatile for different tasks.
meanings.sent2: We were impressed by the convertibilities of the software to multiple file formats.
meanings.sent3: The cat's convertibilities from lazy to playful always amused the family.
meanings.sent4: His convertibilities in adapting to new situations were truly remarkable.
meanings.sent5: The artist showcased the convertibilities of clay into beautiful sculptures.

meanings.definition: The degree to which something can be converted.
meanings.sent1: The convertibilities of the material into various shapes were endless.
meanings.sent2: We explored the convertibilities of the data into meaningful insights.
meanings.sent3: The convertibilities of the recipe into a gourmet dish surprised everyone.
meanings.sent4: The convertibilities of his ideas into successful projects were evident.
meanings.sent5: The students discussed the convertibilities of energy from one form to another.
